result.execSummary:
The defendant David M Leary was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC [Modifiers: On or Near a School], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Criminal Trespass to Dwelling, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent

Arresting Agency: FAPD

  If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: With elements and criminal case settlement agreement forms attached.

case called at 8:52m. [MK]
Defendant David M Leary in court with Attorney Yelena O. Zarwell.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.

On Motion of the State, the Court amends Count #1 to Misdemeanor Possession of THC (on/near school) contrary to Statute 961.41(3g)(3) and 961.495

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " No Contest  " entered on Counts #1, #2; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the pleas, finds Mr. Leary guilty of both counts, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On agreement of the parties, the Court reads in and dismisses Counts #3, #4, #5.

During the Sentencing portion of the hearing, the Court discloses to the parties that Mr. Leary knows Judge Weston's two children.  The Court feels no need to recuse. No party voices an objection this this.

On Counts #1 & #2, the Court withholds sentence, and places Mr. Leary on Probation for 18 months, with conditions:

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with treatment recommendations
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, and counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--no possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--to submit to random urinalyses or other drug testing; testing is to occur at least one time per month and thereafter as required by the Agent 
--on Count #1 only: to perform 100 hours of community service 
--no contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate by the Agent, and except for incidental contact at work or educational programming as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--on Count #1: to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge plus $50 drug testing fee
--on Count #2: to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge



Days credit for time already served:  1 day
recess 9:07am
Status conference on December 16, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on November 26, 2014 at 11:00 am.

Prior: 423 W. Linden Dr, Jefferson, WI 53549

Case called at 10:44 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant David M Leary in court with Attorney Yelena Olegovna Zarwell. ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court examines the Defendant as to rights, understanding & intent.  
Mr. Leary waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Arraignment.
State files information

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--maximum penalties recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered
Upon questioning of the Court, Mr. Leary provides updated address
Recess: 10:48 am 

NEXT: (1) DA PTC scheduled for 11/26/14 at 11:00 am - Send notices (2) Schedule STC 2-3 weeks after DA PTC - Send notices
Preliminary hearing on October 21, 2014 at 10:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on September 17, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Case called at 1:16 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant David M Leary appears in custody, via video, from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Yelena Olegovna Zarwell. Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Zarwell informs the Court that Mr. Leary qualifies for SPD Services

Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given.
Service of Complaint admitted; address & dob confirmed accurate; maximum penalties recited; reading waived
Court finds probable cause within the Complaint to support Counts #1 - #5

Court requires a $1500 signature bond, with conditions:
-No possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription 
-No possession of drug paraphernalia
-No contact with Zeno Bell, Amanda Bell, Anthony Bell or Sandra Bell
-No presence at 505 East St. or Salamone's, Fort Atkinson
-No possession or consumption of alcohol 
-No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores except as necessary for employment purposes
-May be present in Blackhawk Tavern for employment purposes only
-May have possession of alcohol for employment purposes only at the Blackhawk Tavern

Preliminary Hearing time limits waived upon agreement of parties 
Recess: 1:27 pm 

NEXT: (1) DA Pre-trial Conference scheduled for 9/17/14 at 3:00 pm - Send notices (2) Schedule Preliminary Hearing 2-3 weeks after DA PTC - Send notices **Pleas Not Taken on Misdemeanor Charges**
